name: topic filter
info:
## MQTT Topic filter

### Description
Filters messages based on the value of `msg.topic` using standard MQTT topic filter notation.
* `#` match all
* `+` match one level

### example filters
* `home/+/temperature` 
  * will match `home/bedroom/temperature`
  * will match `home/livingroom/temperature`
  * will not match `home/room/1/temperature`
  * will not match `room/1/temperature`
* `home/#` 
  * will match `home/location`
  * will match `home/livingroom/temperature`
  * will match `home/livingroom/humidity`
  * will not match `room/1/temperature`


### Outputs

#### Output 1 - match
Messages with a topic that matches the `topic filter` will be sent out this output.

#### Output 2 - no match
Messages with a topic that does not match the `topic filter` will be sent out this output to permit next level filtering

meta.author: steve-mcl
meta.desc: A node to filter MQTT topics

name: Broker.GetDatapoints
info:
# GetDatapoints

Request a set of datapoints (values)

Expects `msg.payload` to contain an array with multiple VSS signal names or a string containing a single name.

Returns an object containing all the requested datapoints as `msg.payload`.
If there is an error, `msg.error` is set to the error description.

${msg.payload.version}`, icon_name: icons[msg.payload.type] || "fa-question", _id: msg.payload.id, _version: msg.payload.version, _name: msg.payload.name, _type: msg.payload.type } msg.payload = payload return msg;
